Container.Name: Grive2
Container.Overview:
Backup your files to Google Drive using Grive2 client in a docker container
Before you Start this Container: 1 - Go to https://console.developers.google.com/apis/library. Login with your Google account and create a new project on Google Cloud Platform. You can also use an existing one. 2 -Search for Google Drive API and enable it. 3 -Go to API Credentials page (https://console.developers.google.com/apis/credentials) 4 -Create a new OAuth Client credential. Select TV as device type. You will be provided with a id and a secret. 5 -Save both CLIENT_ID and SECRET because you gonna need it for grive2. 6- Got to this URL and append your CLIENT_ID https://accounts.google.com/o/oauth2/auth?scope=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.googleapis.com%2Fauth%2Fdrive&redirect_uri=urn:ietf:wg:oauth:2.0:oob&response_type=code&client_id= FILL_HERE_YOUR_CLIENT_ID 7- Give permission to the app and copy the CODE provided 8- Fill in this template with CLIENT_ID, SECRET and CODE 9- Run it the first time and let it start Sync 10- Once it starts you can now remove the CODE variable from this template to be safe 11- Enjoy Grive2 on Unraid!! 12- Set GRIVE_PARAMS to for example -s my_drive_folder to sync that specific folder on Google Drive 13- Leaving this field blank will sync your whole Google Drive.
Container.Description: Backup your files to Google Drive using Grive2 client in a docker container

Config.Name: UNRAID_FOLDER
Config.Description: Path to the unraid folder in which to sync the files, it also will contain .grive config file

Config.Name: CLIENT_ID
Config.Description: Your Client ID obtained by doing the procedure in the description

Config.Name: SECRET
Config.Description: Your Client Secret obtained by doing the procedure in the description

Config.Name: CODE
Config.Description: Your client secret obtained from the URL in the description Delete me after the setup is completed

Config.Name: GRIVE_PARAMS
Config.Description: Passes parameters to grive2. For example -s my_drive_folder. See https://github.com/agusalex/grive2docker#grive-settings
